analysis: The documents all pertain to the establishment of presidential commissions, committees, or boards. These entities are created to address specific issues, conduct studies, provide advice, or make recommendations to the President on a variety of topics, ranging from economic matters and trade to social issues and national security. The commissions are typically composed of members appointed by the President, often with representation from various sectors, including government, private industry, and the general public. They operate for a defined period, with a mandate to produce a report or recommendations on their assigned topic.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups
